Hi, I'm Arul Arora.

I'm a Systems Design Engineering student at the Univeristy of Waterloo.

ABOUT ME

From designing and planning video game stages I wish existed, to developing skills in martial arts that eventually led me to get my black belt, my childhood consisted of displaying my creativity. I continued to express this in high school where I was exposed to a technological design course and solved multidisciplinary problems using advanced technology. Above all, this course helped to elucidate that technology has a major impact on our lives and in the world around us. Knowing that I could use these skills to confer societal benefits, it became apparent that I wanted to pursue a career in this direction. From that point forward, I began my journey of becoming an engineer.

I am currently in my second year of Systems Design Engineering. Being a Systems Design Engineer student allows me to explore a variety of engineering topics. This enables me to to satisfy my own curiosity as I tend to learn new skills whenever possible. Whether that be during co-op terms where I work in a professional environment for four months, or while taking complex engineering courses in university, I always try to find ways to explore technologies and skills that I am interested in. Below are some of the skills that I have developed throughout my engineering journey thus far as well as my past work experiences.

SKILLS

C/C++

JavaScript

HTML

CSS

Excel VBA

SQL

EXPERIENCE

Software Integration Analyst @ Paramount Commerce and Mazooma

September - December 2021

  • In my recent co-op position I tested and troubleshot my company's payment processing API that was integrated on merchant's web/mobile applications
  • To expedite the end-to-end integration of our API product onto native apps, I introduced a mobile emulator tool used for functional testing and standardized an API test guideline
  • Wanting to further improve our API, I collaborated cross-functionally with the development and QA team to diagnose and solve issues in the API parameters
  • I also generated reports using SQL in the staging database with over 100 million records; these displayed key metrics pertaining to the performance of our company's product

Process Engineer @ BWX Technologies

January - April 2021

  • In my first co-op position, I collected data to accellerate a $140-million nuclear project which involved shifting 480 fuel channels in Bruce Power's unit 3 nuclear reactor
  • To expedite and enhance the data collection process, I developed the software that tracked, transferred and computed data through databases to resolve multiple technical issues and double the process speed of data computation
  • I also designed a logbook which accumulated updates on the progress of every fuel channel being shifted and any potential hazards within the training facility
  • This ensured that the upcoming day/night shift understood which data needed to be collected and also provided the project managers with a history of past events

Hyperloop Engineer @ Waterloop

January 2021 - Present

  • To keep myself occupied when I have spare time, I am on a university design team that is designing and constructing a hyperloop to demonstrate the feasibility of hyperloop's in the transportation industry
  • I am currently on the software communication team helping to develop a CAN based communication network inside the hyperloop which will be used to control pod subsytems and send telemetry data to our remote desktop controller
  • My previous role in the team was as a propulsion engineer - I resaerched, designed and manufactured a linear induction motor that magnetically propels and levitates our hyperloop pod

Aquatic Instructor @ The Town of Milton

August 2018 - July 2020

  • While studying in high school, I worked part time as a swimming instructor teaching people of all ages how to swim and survive in the water in 2-month long courses
  • Each shift I taught 8 different classes comprised of 5 to 10 students or 1 student who required special assistance
  • I tracked the progression of my students using 8 spreadsheets and this optimized writing the end of term report cards
  • I publicized safety standards to everyone in and around the pool and was ready to support in any injuries/accidents that were to occur

I love meeting new people and I'm always up for a great conversation. Whether you're an employer looking for someone new to join their team, or you're someone who wants to chat and make a new connection, contact me and I'll get back to you as soon as possible!
